question:
3. In a sample dataset, the frequencies of 1, 2, 3, 4 are $p_{1}, p_{2}, p_{3}, p_{4}$ respectively, and $\sum_{i=1}^{4} p_{i}=1$. Among the following four scenarios, the one corresponding to the largest sample standard deviation is（）
A. $p_{1}=p_{4}=0.1, p_{2}=p_{3}=0.4$
B. $p_{1}=p_{4}=0.4, p_{2}=p_{3}=0.1$
C. $p_{1}=p_{4}=0.2, p_{2}=p_{3}=0.3$
D. $p_{1}=p_{4}=0.3, p_{2}=p_{3}=0.2$

error.specific_error_point: The student only performed detailed calculations for options A and C. After finding the results to be 0.65 and 1.05, they immediately chose C (assuming 1.05 was the largest), without realizing that option B actually had the largest standard deviation.
error.reason_for_error: The student did not formulate a scientific problem-solving strategy and only made partial attempts. They lacked a comprehensive analysis of all options, causing them to miss the true maximum value. In actual exams, this phenomenon of only checking some of the options is very common.
